3  Ike Dike Alternatives and Gate Design Debates

Local pilots raised navigational concerns about the Corps’ double-sector gate, prompting Texas A\&M’s Institute for a Disaster-Resilient Texas to study arch and barge-gate options in 2024[^25]

Early simulations suggest a wider, single-sector gate could halve dredging costs without sacrificing surge performance—an engineering decision that will influence both construction phasing and real-estate risk maps over the next decade

## 6
Taken together, these measures represent a **structural re-pricing of location risk** across Greater Houston

For stakeholders across the property spectrum, from single-family builders to global energy majors, understanding the shifting code base and infrastructure map is no longer optional—it is the key to de-risking investments and sustaining Houston’s momentum through the next century of storms, heat, and coastal change
